game.unwireConfirm: Are you sure you want to remove this circuit's wiring? The old wire will be discarded.

result.overBudgetHint: Circuit works normally, but wire cost ${{cost}} exceeds budget ${{budget}}. Try cheaper wires?
result.trippedHint: {{prefix}}Total current {{current}}A exceeded NFB rating {{rated}}A, triggering breaker protection.
result.burnedHint: {{prefix}}Total current {{current}}A exceeded {{crossSection}}mm² wire's max current {{maxCurrent}}A. Prolonged overload caused burnout. Try thicker wire?
result.neutralBurnedHint: Phase R and Phase T loads are severely unbalanced. Neutral current exceeded 30A safe capacity causing burnout. Try balancing the load between phases!
result.mainTrippedHint: Total panel current exceeded main breaker rating, triggering trip protection. All circuits lost power! Please redesign circuit layout to reduce total simultaneous load.
result.leakageHint: {{label}} experienced leakage, but no ELCB was installed, causing electrocution danger! Always install ELCB for wet area circuits.

planner.title: Circuit Planning
planner.empty: No circuits yet. Click "+ Add Circuit" to start planning.
planner.assignAllAppliances: Please assign all appliances to circuits
planner.selectAllWires: Please select wire for each circuit

panel.title: Panel Interior
panel.subtitle: Drag wires to rearrange lanes, eliminate crossings, place cable ties

L01.name: L01 Basics
L01.description: Connect a hair dryer and power on. Understand P ÷ V = I.

L02.name: L02 Wire Trap
L02.description: Use hair dryer and kettle together. Choose your wire carefully!

L03.name: L03 Cost Tradeoff
L03.description: Same appliances, tighter budget. Can't blindly pick the thickest wire.

L04.name: L04 Low Power Trap
L04.description: Under-sink heater at 800W seems harmless? Add a kettle for 8 seconds.

L05.name: L05 Endurance
L05.description: Heater + Kettle, total 30A. Need thick wire to survive!

L06.name: L06 Free Circuit Intro
L06.description: First free circuit experience! Two rooms, three appliances — you decide.

L07.name: L07 High Power
L07.description: Space Heater 16.4A — first time 1.6mm² isn't enough!

L08.name: L08 Kitchen Circuits
L08.description: Kettle, microwave, heater — three high-power appliances, how to split?

L09.name: L09 Mixed Voltage
L09.description: Kitchen 110V + Laundry 220V. Different voltages need different circuits!

L10.name: L10 Full House
L10.description: Five rooms, seven appliances — your first full house design!

L11.name: L11 Phase Balance Intro
L11.description: Single-phase three-wire! Balance R and T phases or the neutral burns.

L12.name: L12 Phase Balance Pro
L12.description: More appliances, manual phase switching. You choose R or T for each circuit.

L13.name: L13 ELCB Intro
L13.description: Wet bathroom areas must have ELCB. No ELCB = electrocution!

L14.name: L14 ELCB Budget
L14.description: Bathroom ELCB required, plus high-power kitchen — budget is tight.

L15.name: L15 Combined Challenge
L15.description: Phase balance + ELCB + multi-room. All v0.4 mechanics as free circuits!

L16.name: L16 Crimp Intro
L16.description: Must crimp after wiring to power on. Learn crimping in low-pressure.

L17.name: L17 Crimp Quality Test
L17.description: Poor crimp = high resistance = faster overheating! Crimp well for high-power.

L18.name: L18 Old House: Diagnosis
L18.description: Open the old panel — circuit c1 has no terminal! Rewire and fix.

L19.name: L19 Old House: Full Check
L19.description: Kitchen wire too thin, living room has no terminal. Two problem circuits!

L20.name: L20 Old House: Danger
L20.description: Final exam! Oxidized splice, bare wire, wrong gauge — three problems plus wet bathroom and phase balance.

L21.name: L21 Routing Intro
L21.description: Design circuits then organize the panel. Learn lane arrangement and cable ties.

L22.name: L22 Crossing Maze
L22.description: 5 rooms + mixed voltage + manual phase. Planning affects routing difficulty!

L23.name: L23 Perfect Panel
L23.description: Final exam! All mechanics — free circuits + phase + ELCB + crimp + routing.

L24.name: L24 Old House: Protection Gap
L24.description: Kitchen's 30A NFB can't protect 20A wire! Replace NFB and fix bare wire.

L25.name: L25 Old House: Wet Trap
L25.description: Bathroom circuit has no ELCB! Install ELCB for safety, fix oxidized splice.

L26.name: L26 Old House: All Five
L26.description: All 5 problem types appear! Diagnose each circuit, fix them all, balance phases.

L27.name: L27 Old House: Renovate + Route
L27.description: Fix problems then organize the panel. First full renovation + routing experience!

L28.name: L28 Old House: Ultimate
L28.description: Final exam! 5 circuits + 4 problems + phase + leakage + routing = ultimate challenge.

random.title: Random Old House Challenge
random.levelDesc: Randomly generated old house — {{circuits}} circuits, {{problems}} problems
